timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.message: Update surefire version to 3.0.0-M4 to solve the display report issue

timeline.bodyText: Does this print out the running test?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
For code:
@ParameterizedTest(name = "{displayName} with [{arguments}]")
@ValueSource(strings = { "val0", "val1" })
public void testDisplay(String someValue)

In surefire report, the parameterized display name looks like below:
Before this change:
 <testcase name="testDisplay{String}[1]" classname="com.example.MyTest" time="0.029"/>
  <testcase name="testDisplay{String}[2]" classname="com.example.MyTest" time="0.002"/>

After this change:
  <testcase name="testDisplay(String) with val0" classname="com.example.MyTest" time="0.029"/>
  <testcase name="testDisplay(String) with val1" classname="com.example.MyTest" time="0.002"/>

Check the Test tab for new display:
https://dev.azure.com/azure-sdk/public/_build/results?buildId=360455&view=ms.vss-test-web.build-test-results-tab
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I saw the comment on github issue last night and it only worked for reporting and wouldn't print the tests that are running on the console. @alzimmermsft has a PR that will print all running test names.
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Generally we don't want to be retrying failing tests as this could mask flakiness in our clients.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Remove the failed retry count from appconfig
